listitem.para: In the BioPreDyn package, navigate to build/install/bin and create a new XML file workflow.xml.
Open it with your favourite XML editor and write the following code:
listitem.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <sedML xmlns="http://sed-ml.org/sed-ml/level1/version2" level="1" version="2"> <listOfSimulations> <uniformTimeCourse id="simulation_1" name="simulation_1" initialTime="0.0" outputStartTime="0.0" outputEndTime="20.0" numberOfPoints="200"> <algorithm kisaoID="KISAO:0000032" /> </uniformTimeCourse> </listOfSimulations> <listOfModels> <model id="febs_model" language="urn:sedml:language:sbml" source="FEBS_antimony.xml"> </model> </listOfModels> <listOfTasks> <task id="task_1" name="task_1" modelReference="febs_model" simulationReference="simulation_1"> </task> </listOfTasks> </sedML>
listitem.para: This SED-ML file describes the execution of a time course simulation on a model described in the local file FEBS_antimony.xml.
Execute it by typing the following command: python biopredynCL.py --sedml workflow.xml
